intro: Telipogon setosus, commonly known as the hairy leek, is a rare and distinctive member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and feathery, finely divided leaves that give it a delicate, lacy appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in an umbel, typical of many members of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Telipogon setosus is considered a conservation concern in many areas.
